lead_paragraph: BAKER--Elizabeth, "Betsy." Elizabeth "Betsy" Lentz Baker died unexpectedly in Savannah, GA on December 4, 2015 after a brief illness. A resident of Manhattan's Upper West Side for 50 years, and more recently of Tuxedo Park, NY, Betsy was born in Kittanning, PA, on August 13, 1936 to Elizabeth Fleming Wagner and William Roy Baker and was raised in State College, PA and Wilmington, DE where she graduated from Alexis I. DuPont High School. She earned a B.S. degree from Drexel University specializing in textile chemistry and was a member of Delta Zeta Sorority. She worked for Celanese, Hercules, Inc., and as a commercial print model. Betsy volunteered with The Leukemia Society, Community Board 7, various cancer support groups, and Manhattan's Bull Moose Dog Run. A longtime survivor of tonsilar area cancer, which she faced with courage and conviction, Betsy was an inspiration to all those who knew her. Despite the physical challenges with which the disease left her, Betsy was able to flourish thanks to the devoted care of her physician, Dr. Margaret Lewin. Survived by stepfather Romeo Barrick Wagner, cousins Robert Hayman, Sr. (Sally), Robert Hayman, Jr. (Sherry), and Victoria Sutton (James) and her poodle, Queen Victoria "Tori." Donations in Betsy's memory may be made to "Case Western Reserve University School of Medicine/The Albert L. Lewin, M.D. Award Fund for Clinical Excellence in Pediatrics," Office of Advancement Services, Case Western Reserve University, 10900 Euclid Avenue, Cleveland, Ohio 44106-7035. Telephone 216-368-2000. 1/3
